Brooklyn Historical Society
Brooklyn Common Council Register
Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.). Common Council
1978.165
0.06 Linear feet in one folder.
1894-1901 This collection consists of one volume, a register, listing changes in Brooklyn street names. A0143
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of one volume, a register, listing changes in Brooklyn street names. Most streets cover the neighborhoods of Williamsburg, Greenpoint, Bushwick, and Flatbush.
Arrangement
There is only one volume in this collection. The register is organized alphabetically by street name.
Historical note
The Common Council of the City of Brooklyn was formed in 1853 and consisted of the Mayor and a Board of Aldermen. The Common Council also appointed a Clerk who served as City Clerk for a year. The Common Council had the power to pass ordinances, manage and regulate city finances, establish and regulate police and fire departments, and regulate City-owned waterfront property, among other powers.
In 1896 and 1897, the Common Council's Special Committee on Renaming Streets adopted resolutions to change street names.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Material in this collection is in the public domain.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Immediate source and date of acquisition is unknown.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Common Council Register, 1978.165, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Related Materials
Center for Brooklyn History holds the following related materials:
- Brooklyn Common Council Wallabout Park planning records, 1835-1842 (1978.138)
- Brooklyn public improvements collection, circa 1830s-1880s (1977.314)
- Reports and Manuals of the Brooklyn Common Council are cataloged in Center for Brooklyn History's Main bibliographic collection.
New York Public Library, New-York Historical Society, and Queens Public Library also hold Manuals of the Common Council of the city of Brooklyn.
